title: (x) Wallpaper magazine sans - Amplitude {Geoff}
content:
Does anyone know the name of the sans used for headings in Wallpaper mag.

Many Thanks!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20101117063314im_/http:/typophile.com/files/wallpaper_typo_001_4251.jpg)
author: henand

comments.content: using a font with inktraps for headlines.. yeesh.

There's a liquor store by my friend's house that uses [Bell Centennial Bold Listing](http://web.archive.org/web/20101117063314/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=LH.6085.0.4&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=LIQUOR+STORE&sampleSize=32) on their sign. I cringe every time I see it.

- Lex
I find it fun, although the traps lose their point. But I imagine whoever did it must find that it gives a different to what could be an otherwise regular sans.

I'm sorry to shock some of you, but I personally think ink traps make bold design statements. I simply luuurve oversized [Bell Centennial](http://web.archive.org/web/20101117063314/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&font_categories=1&font_categories_search=font_name_search&searchstr=bell+centennial), [FF Hydra](http://web.archive.org/web/20101117063314/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&font_categories_search=font_name_search&searchstr=hydra&image.x=32&image.y=8), [Citizen](http://web.archive.org/web/20101117063314/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&font_categories=1&font_categories_search=font_name_search&searchstr=citizen), [Eunuverse](http://web.archive.org/web/20101117063314/http:/www.vllg.com/Thirstype/Eunuverse/mudTyper+Weights/) and so on.

BTW Geoff, looks like you've been busy while I was gone. I'm in the process tagging and crediting the IDs of the past few days and "bumped into you" a couple of times. Good show. :^)
Traps are sexy when added to the design in a conscious and thoughtful way. Why have such a detail and _not_ use it huge?

\> Good show. :^)

Thanks! It was couple of lucky IDs but I swear I AM getting better at this game. ;^)

Re. the traps, personally I agree with the previous replies. I think these traps look pretty tasty at headline sizes along with Carter's swashy Big Caslon.

I agree,  
It is sort of "breaking the rules" to set large headlines in a font that is crafted to work optimally in 6 points in a telephone book but as long it is done intentionally with some sort of thoughts behind it... why not?  
Rock on

\> _(...) as long it is done intentionally with some sort of thoughts behind itâ€¦_

Now you're talking -- this is the secret key why good designers can even make a beautiful design with an ugly typeface.\*

_(\*) Quoted liberally from Wolfgang Weingart._
I'm pretty sure the ink traps are intentionally exaggerated in Amplitude.
